<s> esmond's faithful john lockwood came to wait on his mistress during their absence though he would have preferred to escort mrs <\s>
<s> lucy his sweetheart on her journey into the country <\s>
<s> we had a gloomy and silent meal it seemed as if a darkness was over the house since the bright face of beatrix had been withdrawn from it <\s>
<s> in the afternoon came a message from the favorite to relieve us somewhat from this despondency <\s>
<s> the queen hath been much shaken the note said she is better now and all things will go well <\s>
<s> let my lord castlewood be ready against we send for him <\s>
<s> at night there came a second billet there hath been a great battle in council lord treasurer hath broke his staff and hath fallen never to rise again no successor is appointed <\s>
<s> lord b  receives a great whig company to night at golden square <\s>
<s> if he is trimming others are true the queen hath no more fits but is a bed now and more quiet <\s>
<s> be ready against morning when i still hope all will be well <\s>
<s> the prince came home shortly after the messenger who bore this billet had left the house <\s>
<s> his royal highness was so much the better for the bishop's liquor that to talk affairs to him now was of little service <\s>
<s> he was helped to the royal bed he called castlewood familiarly by his own name he quite forgot the part upon the acting of which his crown his safety depended <\s>
<s> twas lucky that my lady castlewood's servants were out of the way and only those heard him who would not betray him <\s>
<s> he inquired after the adorable beatrix with a royal hiccup in his voice he was easily got to bed and in a minute or two plunged in that deep slumber and forgetfulness with which bacchus rewards the votaries of that god <\s>
<s> we wished beatrix had been there to see him in his cups <\s>
<s> we regretted perhaps that she was gone <\s>
<s> one of the party at kensington square was fool enough to ride to hounslow that night coram latronibus and to the inn which the family used ordinarily in their journeys out of london <\s>
<s> esmond desired my landlord not to acquaint madam beatrix with his coming and had the grim satisfaction of passing by the door of the chamber where she lay with her maid and of watching her chariot set forth in the early morning <\s>
<s> he saw her smile and slip money into the man's hand who was ordered to ride behind the coach as far as bagshot <\s>
<s> the road being open and the other servant armed it appeared she dispensed with the escort of a second domestic and this fellow bidding his young mistress adieu with many bows went and took a pot of ale in the kitchen and returned in company with his brother servant john coachman and his horses back to london <\s>
<s> and i will give you frankly my opinion that a house where a prince lies all day who respects no woman is no house for a young unmarried lady that you were better in the country than here that he is here on a great end from which no folly should divert him and that having nobly done your part of this morning beatrix you should retire off the scene awhile and leave it to the other actors of the play <\s>
<s> as the colonel spoke with a perfect calmness and politeness such as tis to be hoped he hath always shown to women his mistress stood by him on one side of the table and frank castlewood on the other hemming in poor beatrix that was behind it and as it were surrounding her with our approaches <\s>
<s> my dear father saith quite truly that his manner towards our sex was uniformly courteous <\s>
<s> from my infancy upwards he treated me with an extreme gentleness as though i was a little lady <\s>
<s> i can scarce remember though i tried him often ever hearing a rough word from him nor was he less grave and kind in his manner to the humblest negresses on his estate <\s>
<s> he was familiar with no one except my mother and it was delightful to witness up to the very last days the confidence between them <\s>
<s> he was obeyed eagerly by all under him and my mother and all her household lived in a constant emulation to please him and quite a terror lest in any way they should offend him <\s>
<s> he was the humblest man with all this the least exacting the more easily contented and mr <\s>
<s> benson our minister at castlewood who attended him at the last ever said i know not what colonel esmond's doctrine was but his life and death were those of a devout christian r <\s>
<s> having twice sallied out and been beaten back she now as i expected tried the ultima ratio of women and had recourse to tears <\s>
<s> her beautiful eyes filled with them i never could bear in her nor in any woman that expression of pain i am alone sobbed she you are three against me my brother my mother and you <\s>
<s> what have i done that you should speak and look so unkindly at me <\s>
<s> is it my fault that the prince should as you say admire me <\s>
<s> did i bring him here <\s>
<s> did i do aught but what you bade me in making him welcome <\s>
<s> did you not tell me that our duty was to die for him <\s>
<s> did you not teach me mother night and morning to pray for the king before even ourselves <\s>
<s> what would you have of me cousin for you are the chief of the conspiracy against me i know you are sir and that my mother and brother are acting but as you bid them whither would you have me go <\s>
<s> i would but remove from the prince says esmond gravely a dangerous temptation heaven forbid i should say you would yield i would only have him free of it <\s>
<s> your honor needs no guardian please god but his imprudence doth <\s>
<s> he is so far removed from all women by his rank that his pursuit of them cannot but be unlawful <\s>
<s> we would remove the dearest and fairest of our family from the chance of that insult and that is why we would have you go dear beatrix <\s>
<s> harry speaks like a book says frank with one of his oaths and by every word he saith is true <\s>
<s> you can't help being handsome trix no more can the prince help following you <\s>
<s> my counsel is that you go out of harm's way for by the lord were the prince to play any tricks with you king as he is or is to be harry esmond and i would have justice of him <\s>
<s> are not two such champions enough to guard me <\s>
<s> says beatrix something sorrowfully sure with you two watching no evil could happen to me <\s>

<s> the road being open and the other servant armed it appeared she dispensed with the escort of a second domestic and this fellow bidding his young mistress adieu with many bows went and took a pot of ale in the kitchen and returned in company with his brother servant john coachman and his horses back to london <\s>
<s> and i will give you frankly my opinion that a house where a prince lies all day who respects no woman is no house for a young unmarried lady that you were better in the country than here that he is here on a great end from which no folly should divert him and that having nobly done your part of this morning beatrix you should retire off the scene awhile and leave it to the other actors of the play <\s>
<s> as the colonel spoke with a perfect calmness and politeness such as tis to be hoped he hath always shown to women his mistress stood by him on one side of the table and frank castlewood on the other hemming in poor beatrix that was behind it and as it were surrounding her with our approaches <\s>
<s> my dear father saith quite truly that his manner towards our sex was uniformly courteous <\s>
<s> from my infancy upwards he treated me with an extreme gentleness as though i was a little lady <\s>
<s> i can scarce remember though i tried him often ever hearing a rough word from him nor was he less grave and kind in his manner to the humblest negresses on his estate <\s>
<s> he was familiar with no one except my mother and it was delightful to witness up to the very last days the confidence between them <\s>
<s> he was obeyed eagerly by all under him and my mother and all her household lived in a constant emulation to please him and quite a terror lest in any way they should offend him <\s>
<s> he was the humblest man with all this the least exacting the more easily contented and mr <\s>

<s> i would but remove from the prince says esmond gravely a dangerous temptation heaven forbid i should say you would yield i would only have him free of it <\s>
<s> your honor needs no guardian please god but his imprudence doth <\s>
<s> he is so far removed from all women by his rank that his pursuit of them cannot but be unlawful <\s>
<s> we would remove the dearest and fairest of our family from the chance of that insult and that is why we would have you go dear beatrix <\s>
<s> harry speaks like a book says frank with one of his oaths and by every word he saith is true <\s>
<s> you can't help being handsome trix no more can the prince help following you <\s>

<s> are not two such champions enough to guard me <\s>
<s> says beatrix something sorrowfully sure with you two watching no evil could happen to me <\s>

<s> burst out beatrix in a passion of tears and mortification <\s>

<s> she swept out of the room with the air of an empress flinging glances of defiance at us all and leaving us conquerors of the field but scared and almost ashamed of our victory <\s>
<s> it did indeed seem hard and cruel that we three should have conspired the banishment and humiliation of that fair creature <\s>
<s> we looked at each other in silence twas not the first stroke by many of our actions in that unlucky time which being done we wished undone <\s>

<s> she swept out of the room with the air of an empress flinging glances of defiance at us all and leaving us conquerors of the field but scared and almost ashamed of our victory <\s>
<s> it did indeed seem hard and cruel that we three should have conspired the banishment and humiliation of that fair creature <\s>
<s> we looked at each other in silence twas not the first stroke by many of our actions in that unlucky time which being done we wished undone <\s>
<s> we agreed it was best she should go alone speaking stealthily to one another and under our breaths like persons engaged in an act they felt ashamed in doing <\s>
<s> in a half hour it might be after our talk she came back her countenance wearing the same defiant air which it had borne when she left us <\s>
<s> she held a shagreen case in her hand esmond knew it as containing his diamonds which he had given to her for her marriage with duke hamilton and which she had worn so splendidly on the inauspicious night of the prince's arrival <\s>
<s> i have brought back says she to the marquis of esmond the present he deigned to make me in days when he trusted me better than now <\s>

<s> we were right yet by her manner she had put us all in the wrong we were conquerors yet the honors of the day seemed to be with the poor oppressed girl <\s>
<s> that luckless box containing the stones had first been ornamented with a baron's coronet when beatrix was engaged to the young gentleman from whom she parted and afterwards the gilt crown of a duchess figured on the cover which also poor beatrix was destined never to wear <\s>
<s> lady castlewood opened the case mechanically and scarce thinking what she did and behold besides the diamonds esmond's present there lay in the box the enamelled miniature of the late duke which beatrix had laid aside with her mourning when the king came into the house and which the poor heedless thing very likely had forgotten <\s>
<s> do you leave this too beatrix <\s>

<s> his royal highness was so much the better for the bishop's liquor that to talk affairs to him now was of little service <\s>
<s> he was helped to the royal bed he called castlewood familiarly by his own name he quite forgot the part upon the acting of which his crown his safety depended <\s>
<s> twas lucky that my lady castlewood's servants were out of the way and only those heard him who would not betray him <\s>
<s> he inquired after the adorable beatrix with a royal hiccup in his voice he was easily got to bed and in a minute or two plunged in that deep slumber and forgetfulness with which bacchus rewards the votaries of that god <\s>
<s> we wished beatrix had been there to see him in his cups <\s>
<s> we regretted perhaps that she was gone <\s>
<s> one of the party at kensington square was fool enough to ride to hounslow that night coram latronibus and to the inn which the family used ordinarily in their journeys out of london <\s>
<s> esmond desired my landlord not to acquaint madam beatrix with his coming and had the grim satisfaction of passing by the door of the chamber where she lay with her maid and of watching her chariot set forth in the early morning <\s>
<s> he saw her smile and slip money into the man's hand who was ordered to ride behind the coach as far as bagshot <\s>
<s> the road being open and the other servant armed it appeared she dispensed with the escort of a second domestic and this fellow bidding his young mistress adieu with many bows went and took a pot of ale in the kitchen and returned in company with his brother servant john coachman and his horses back to london <\s>
<s> and i will give you frankly my opinion that a house where a prince lies all day who respects no woman is no house for a young unmarried lady that you were better in the country than here that he is here on a great end from which no folly should divert him and that having nobly done your part of this morning beatrix you should retire off the scene awhile and leave it to the other actors of the play <\s>
<s> as the colonel spoke with a perfect calmness and politeness such as tis to be hoped he hath always shown to women his mistress stood by him on one side of the table and frank castlewood on the other hemming in poor beatrix that was behind it and as it were surrounding her with our approaches <\s>
<s> my dear father saith quite truly that his manner towards our sex was uniformly courteous <\s>
<s> from my infancy upwards he treated me with an extreme gentleness as though i was a little lady <\s>
<s> i can scarce remember though i tried him often ever hearing a rough word from him nor was he less grave and kind in his manner to the humblest negresses on his estate <\s>
<s> he was familiar with no one except my mother and it was delightful to witness up to the very last days the confidence between them <\s>
<s> he was obeyed eagerly by all under him and my mother and all her household lived in a constant emulation to please him and quite a terror lest in any way they should offend him <\s>
<s> he was the humblest man with all this the least exacting the more easily contented and mr <\s>
<s> benson our minister at castlewood who attended him at the last ever said i know not what colonel esmond's doctrine was but his life and death were those of a devout christian r <\s>

<s> and i will give you frankly my opinion that a house where a prince lies all day who respects no woman is no house for a young unmarried lady that you were better in the country than here that he is here on a great end from which no folly should divert him and that having nobly done your part of this morning beatrix you should retire off the scene awhile and leave it to the other actors of the play <\s>
<s> as the colonel spoke with a perfect calmness and politeness such as tis to be hoped he hath always shown to women his mistress stood by him on one side of the table and frank castlewood on the other hemming in poor beatrix that was behind it and as it were surrounding her with our approaches <\s>
<s> my dear father saith quite truly that his manner towards our sex was uniformly courteous <\s>
<s> from my infancy upwards he treated me with an extreme gentleness as though i was a little lady <\s>

<s> he was familiar with no one except my mother and it was delightful to witness up to the very last days the confidence between them <\s>
<s> he was obeyed eagerly by all under him and my mother and all her household lived in a constant emulation to please him and quite a terror lest in any way they should offend him <\s>
<s> he was the humblest man with all this the least exacting the more easily contented and mr <\s>
<s> benson our minister at castlewood who attended him at the last ever said i know not what colonel esmond's doctrine was but his life and death were those of a devout christian r <\s>
<s> having twice sallied out and been beaten back she now as i expected tried the ultima ratio of women and had recourse to tears <\s>
<s> her beautiful eyes filled with them i never could bear in her nor in any woman that expression of pain i am alone sobbed she you are three against me my brother my mother and you <\s>

<s> is it my fault that the prince should as you say admire me <\s>

<s> did i do aught but what you bade me in making him welcome <\s>

<s> did you not teach me mother night and morning to pray for the king before even ourselves <\s>

<s> i would but remove from the prince says esmond gravely a dangerous temptation heaven forbid i should say you would yield i would only have him free of it <\s>
<s> your honor needs no guardian please god but his imprudence doth <\s>
<s> he is so far removed from all women by his rank that his pursuit of them cannot but be unlawful <\s>
<s> we would remove the dearest and fairest of our family from the chance of that insult and that is why we would have you go dear beatrix <\s>
<s> harry speaks like a book says frank with one of his oaths and by every word he saith is true <\s>
<s> you can't help being handsome trix no more can the prince help following you <\s>
<s> my counsel is that you go out of harm's way for by the lord were the prince to play any tricks with you king as he is or is to be harry esmond and i would have justice of him <\s>
<s> are not two such champions enough to guard me <\s>
<s> says beatrix something sorrowfully sure with you two watching no evil could happen to me <\s>

<s> tis twelve o'clock bid the coach cousin be ready at one <\s>
<s> burst out beatrix in a passion of tears and mortification <\s>
<s> you disgrace me by your cruel precautions my own mother is the first to suspect me and would take me away as my gaoler <\s>
<s> i will not go with you mother i will go as no one's prisoner <\s>
<s> if i wanted to deceive do you think i could find no means of evading you <\s>
<s> my family suspects me <\s>

<s> i have been unhappy there and lonely enough let me go back but spare me at least the humiliation of setting a watch over my misery which is a trial i can't bear <\s>
<s> let me go when you will but alone or not at all <\s>
<s> you three can stay and triumph over my unhappiness and i will bear it as i have borne it before <\s>
<s> let my gaoler in chief go order the coach that is to take me away <\s>
<s> i thank you henry esmond for your share in the conspiracy <\s>
<s> all my life long i'll thank you and remember you and you brother and you mother how shall i show my gratitude to you for your careful defence of my honor <\s>
<s> she swept out of the room with the air of an empress flinging glances of defiance at us all and leaving us conquerors of the field but scared and almost ashamed of our victory <\s>
<s> it did indeed seem hard and cruel that we three should have conspired the banishment and humiliation of that fair creature <\s>
<s> we looked at each other in silence twas not the first stroke by many of our actions in that unlucky time which being done we wished undone <\s>
<s> we agreed it was best she should go alone speaking stealthily to one another and under our breaths like persons engaged in an act they felt ashamed in doing <\s>
<s> in a half hour it might be after our talk she came back her countenance wearing the same defiant air which it had borne when she left us <\s>
<s> she held a shagreen case in her hand esmond knew it as containing his diamonds which he had given to her for her marriage with duke hamilton and which she had worn so splendidly on the inauspicious night of the prince's arrival <\s>
<s> i have brought back says she to the marquis of esmond the present he deigned to make me in days when he trusted me better than now <\s>
<s> i will never accept a benefit or a kindness from henry esmond more and i give back these family diamonds which belonged to one king's mistress to the gentleman that suspected i would be another <\s>
<s> have you been upon your message of coach caller my lord marquis <\s>
<s> will you send your valet to see that i do not run away <\s>
<s> we were right yet by her manner she had put us all in the wrong we were conquerors yet the honors of the day seemed to be with the poor oppressed girl <\s>
<s> that luckless box containing the stones had first been ornamented with a baron's coronet when beatrix was engaged to the young gentleman from whom she parted and afterwards the gilt crown of a duchess figured on the cover which also poor beatrix was destined never to wear <\s>
<s> lady castlewood opened the case mechanically and scarce thinking what she did and behold besides the diamonds esmond's present there lay in the box the enamelled miniature of the late duke which beatrix had laid aside with her mourning when the king came into the house and which the poor heedless thing very likely had forgotten <\s>
<s> do you leave this too beatrix <\s>
<s> says her mother taking the miniature out and with a cruelty she did not very often show but there are some moments when the tenderest women are cruel and some triumphs which angels can't forego this remark shows how unjustly and contemptuously even the best of men will sometimes judge of our sex <\s>
<s> lady castlewood had no intention of triumphing over her daughter but from a sense of duty alone pointed out her deplorable wrong h <\s>

<s> she swept out of the room with the air of an empress flinging glances of defiance at us all and leaving us conquerors of the field but scared and almost ashamed of our victory <\s>
<s> it did indeed seem hard and cruel that we three should have conspired the banishment and humiliation of that fair creature <\s>
<s> we looked at each other in silence twas not the first stroke by many of our actions in that unlucky time which being done we wished undone <\s>
<s> we agreed it was best she should go alone speaking stealthily to one another and under our breaths like persons engaged in an act they felt ashamed in doing <\s>
<s> in a half hour it might be after our talk she came back her countenance wearing the same defiant air which it had borne when she left us <\s>
<s> she held a shagreen case in her hand esmond knew it as containing his diamonds which he had given to her for her marriage with duke hamilton and which she had worn so splendidly on the inauspicious night of the prince's arrival <\s>

<s> we were right yet by her manner she had put us all in the wrong we were conquerors yet the honors of the day seemed to be with the poor oppressed girl <\s>
<s> that luckless box containing the stones had first been ornamented with a baron's coronet when beatrix was engaged to the young gentleman from whom she parted and afterwards the gilt crown of a duchess figured on the cover which also poor beatrix was destined never to wear <\s>
<s> lady castlewood opened the case mechanically and scarce thinking what she did and behold besides the diamonds esmond's present there lay in the box the enamelled miniature of the late duke which beatrix had laid aside with her mourning when the king came into the house and which the poor heedless thing very likely had forgotten <\s>
<s> do you leave this too beatrix <\s>

<s> his royal highness was so much the better for the bishop's liquor that to talk affairs to him now was of little service <\s>
<s> he was helped to the royal bed he called castlewood familiarly by his own name he quite forgot the part upon the acting of which his crown his safety depended <\s>
<s> twas lucky that my lady castlewood's servants were out of the way and only those heard him who would not betray him <\s>

<s> we wished beatrix had been there to see him in his cups <\s>
<s> we regretted perhaps that she was gone <\s>
<s> one of the party at kensington square was fool enough to ride to hounslow that night coram latronibus and to the inn which the family used ordinarily in their journeys out of london <\s>
<s> esmond desired my landlord not to acquaint madam beatrix with his coming and had the grim satisfaction of passing by the door of the chamber where she lay with her maid and of watching her chariot set forth in the early morning <\s>
<s> he saw her smile and slip money into the man's hand who was ordered to ride behind the coach as far as bagshot <\s>
<s> the road being open and the other servant armed it appeared she dispensed with the escort of a second domestic and this fellow bidding his young mistress adieu with many bows went and took a pot of ale in the kitchen and returned in company with his brother servant john coachman and his horses back to london <\s>
<s> and i will give you frankly my opinion that a house where a prince lies all day who respects no woman is no house for a young unmarried lady that you were better in the country than here that he is here on a great end from which no folly should divert him and that having nobly done your part of this morning beatrix you should retire off the scene awhile and leave it to the other actors of the play <\s>
<s> as the colonel spoke with a perfect calmness and politeness such as tis to be hoped he hath always shown to women his mistress stood by him on one side of the table and frank castlewood on the other hemming in poor beatrix that was behind it and as it were surrounding her with our approaches <\s>
<s> my dear father saith quite truly that his manner towards our sex was uniformly courteous <\s>
<s> from my infancy upwards he treated me with an extreme gentleness as though i was a little lady <\s>
<s> i can scarce remember though i tried him often ever hearing a rough word from him nor was he less grave and kind in his manner to the humblest negresses on his estate <\s>
<s> he was familiar with no one except my mother and it was delightful to witness up to the very last days the confidence between them <\s>
<s> he was obeyed eagerly by all under him and my mother and all her household lived in a constant emulation to please him and quite a terror lest in any way they should offend him <\s>
<s> he was the humblest man with all this the least exacting the more easily contented and mr <\s>

<s> and i will give you frankly my opinion that a house where a prince lies all day who respects no woman is no house for a young unmarried lady that you were better in the country than here that he is here on a great end from which no folly should divert him and that having nobly done your part of this morning beatrix you should retire off the scene awhile and leave it to the other actors of the play <\s>
<s> as the colonel spoke with a perfect calmness and politeness such as tis to be hoped he hath always shown to women his mistress stood by him on one side of the table and frank castlewood on the other hemming in poor beatrix that was behind it and as it were surrounding her with our approaches <\s>
<s> my dear father saith quite truly that his manner towards our sex was uniformly courteous <\s>
<s> from my infancy upwards he treated me with an extreme gentleness as though i was a little lady <\s>
<s> i can scarce remember though i tried him often ever hearing a rough word from him nor was he less grave and kind in his manner to the humblest negresses on his estate <\s>
<s> he was familiar with no one except my mother and it was delightful to witness up to the very last days the confidence between them <\s>
<s> he was obeyed eagerly by all under him and my mother and all her household lived in a constant emulation to please him and quite a terror lest in any way they should offend him <\s>
<s> he was the humblest man with all this the least exacting the more easily contented and mr <\s>

<s> it did indeed seem hard and cruel that we three should have conspired the banishment and humiliation of that fair creature <\s>
